meanings.def: the fact of somebody being away from a place where they are usually expected to be; the occasion or period of time when somebody is away
examples: in somebody's absence The decision was made in my absence (= while I was not there).
We did not receive any news during his long absence.
My father did all the cooking in my mother's absence.
You will not be paid for the full period of absence.
Your son has had too many absences from school.

meanings.def: the fact of somebody/something not existing or not being available; a lack of something
examples: I was surprised by the absence of any women on the board of directors.
in the absence of somebody/something The case was dismissed in the absence of any definite proof.
In the absence of stone, most houses in the area are built of wood.

meanings.def: used to say that when you are away from somebody that you love, you love them even more
not present in a situation or place, when it is obvious that you should be there
examples: When it came to cleaning up afterwards, Anne was conspicuous by her absence.
The meeting went well but Nigel was conspicuous by his absence.

idioms.idiom: absence makes the heart grow fonder
